org.jamesframework.core.search.stopcriteria

Interface StopCriterion

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MaxRuntime, MaxSteps, MaxStepsWithoutImprovement, MaxTimeWithoutImprovement, MinDelta

    public interface StopCriterion
    Interface of a stop criterion that may be attached to a search to terminate it when a certain condition is met. A specific stop criterion might be applicable to a certain search type only. When trying to use it for an incompatible search, an IncompatibleStopCriterionException may be thrown.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean searchShouldStop(Search<?> search)
      Checks the stop condition for a given search.

    • Method Detail

      • searchShouldStop

        boolean searchShouldStop(Search<?> search)
        Checks the stop condition for a given search. If the search is not compatible with this stop criterion, an IncompatibleStopCriterionException may be thrown. Else, true is returned if the stop condition is met for the given search, so that it should be terminated.
        Parameters:
        search - search for which the stop criterion should be checked
        Returns:
        true if the stop condition is met
        Throws:
        IncompatibleStopCriterionException - when the given search is not compatible with the stop criterion
